name: The Warrior's Way
description: A warrior-assassin is forced to hide in a small town in the American Badlands after refusing a mission.

review.author: Cruise2061
review.heading: Stylish and Arty but Elegant.
review.reviewBody: Imagine a Sergio Leone western with swords. The setting is as sparse as the dialogue but you don't sit through one of his works for the acting or the plot. Warrior's Way is like that. What it lacks is made up in other ways. The choreography is above average, the CGI seamless and the set pieces pure art. And it's all cleverly portrayed, captured and presented. An enjoyable little gem from the genre.
